revision.text:
[[Cryptography]] was used extensively during [[World War II]], with a plethora of [[code (cryptography)|code]] and [[cipher]] systems fielded by the nations involved. In addition, the theoretical and practical aspects of ''[[cryptanalysis]]'', or ''codebreaking'', was much advanced.
Probably the most important codebreaking event of the war was the successful decryption by the Allies of the German [[Cryptanalysis of the Enigma|"Enigma" Cipher]]. The first complete [[cryptanalysis|break]] into Enigma was accomplished by [[Cryptanalysis of the Enigma|Poland]] around 1932; the techniques and insights used were passed to the French and British Allies just before the outbreak of the war in 1939. They were substantially improved by British efforts at the [[Bletchley Park]] research station during the war. Decryption of the [[Cryptanalysis of the Enigma|Enigma Cipher]] allowed the Allies to read important parts of German radio traffic on important networks and was an invaluable source of [[military intelligence]] throughout the war. Intelligence from this source (and other high level sources, including the [[Fish (cryptography)|Fish]] ciphers) was eventually called [[Ultra (cryptography)|Ultra]].<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=uccLlgJDk4gC&dq=World+War+II+cryptography&source=gbs_navlinks_s|title=Battle of Wits: The Complete Story of Codebreaking in World War II|last=Budiansky|first=Stephen|date=2000|publisher=Simon and Schuster|isbn=9780684859323|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=j1MC2d2LPAcC&dq=World+War+II+codebreaking&source=gbs_navlinks_s|title=Codebreakers: The Inside Story of Bletchley Park|last=Hinsley|first=F. H.|last2=Stripp|first2=Alan|date=2001|publisher=Oxford University Press|isbn=9780192801326|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=99oqAwAAQBAJ&dq=World+War+II+codebreaking&source=gbs_navlinks_s|title=Codebreakers' Victory: How the Allied Cryptographers Won World War II|last=Haufler|first=Hervie|date=2014|publisher=Open Road Media|isbn=9781497622562|language=en}}</ref>
A similar break into the most secure Japanese diplomatic cipher, designated [[Purple]] by the US Army Signals Intelligence Service, started before the US entered the war. Product from this source was called [[Magic (cryptography)|Magic]].

revision.text:
[http://www.xcite.com/]{{Infobox company| |logo= | name = X-cite by Alghanim Electronics | | foundation = [[Kuwait]] | location = Shuwaikh, Kuwait| | industry = Consumer Electronics Retail and Home furnishings Retail | products = Diversified | homepage = [http://www.xcite.com/ www.xcite.com] }}
{{advert|date=April 2013}} '''X-cite by Alghanim Electronics''' (part of [[Alghanim Industries]]) is an electronics store currently based in [[Kuwait]]. Their product line includes [http://www.xcite.com/computers-tablets/computers.html computers] & [http://www.xcite.com/computers-tablets/tablets.html tablets], [http://www.xcite.com/phones/mobile-phones.html mobile phones], [http://www.xcite.com/photography/cameras.html cameras], [http://www.xcite.com/tv-video/televisions.html TVs], audio & MP3, games & toys, major appliances, small housewares, [http://www.xcite.com/more-categories/watches.html watches], fitness gear, and home furnishing.
[http://www.xcite.com Xcite Kuwait] has 20 showrooms located in different areas in Kuwait - Al Rai, [[Fahaheel]], [[Hawally]], [[Salmiya]], Avenues Mall, Marina Mall, Sahari Mall, Beitak Tower, Makhiyal Mall (Jahra) ([[Kuwait City]]), [[Jleeb Al-Shuyoukh]], [[Jahra]], Qurain CO-OP, Jabriya CO-OP, Khaldiya CO-OP, Souk Al [[Salmiya]], Liwan Mall, Shuwaik , and Cube Mall
[http://www.xcite.com.sa/ Xcite Saudi Arabia] has 4 showrooms located in different areas in Riyadh, King Abdullah Road, Granada District, Khurais Road and Imall.
'''E-Commerce Portal'''
In December 2011, X-cite launched their e-commerce portal [http://www.xcite.com/ xcite.com].<ref>{{cite web|title=X-cite by Alghanim Electronics launches its all new ecommerce website|url=http://www.meed.com/sectors/other/retail/x-cite-by-alghanim-electronics-launches-its-all-new-ecommerce-website/3117295.article|work=MEED|accessdate=22 April 2013}}</ref> in Kuwait and [http://www.xcite.com.sa/ xcite.com.sa] in KSA
'''Awards'''
X-cite has received the following awards:
* Best Retailer 2010’ by the Middle East Retail Academy Awards * ‘Best Retailer’ and ‘Best Retail IT Executive’ by the 2011 Middle East Retail Academy Awards * ‘Best Retailer’ and ‘Best Retail IT Executive’ by the 2012 Middle East Retail Academy Awards<ref>{{cite web|title=X-cite By Alghanim Electronics wins best retailer at the 2012 Middle East Retail Academy Awards|url=http://www.meed.com/x-cite-by-alghanim-electronics-wins-best-retailer-at-the-2012-middle-east-retail-academy-awards/3140085.article|work=MEED|accessdate=22 April 2013}}</ref> * Facebook ‘Best Interactive Award’ for the electronics category in the GCC region by the Pan Arab Web Awards Academy<ref>{{cite news|title=X-cite by Alghanim Electronics Facebook page wins ‘Best Interactive Award’|url=http://news.kuwaittimes.net/2012/06/30/x-cite-by-alghanim-electronics-facebook-page-wins-best-interactive-award/|accessdate=22 April 2013|newspaper=Kuwait Times}}</ref> * ‘Best Overall Retailer’ by the Gamestream 12 Awards<ref>{{cite news|title=X-cite By Alghanim Electronics wins ‘Best Overall Retailer’ at GameStream12 ME awards|url=http://news.kuwaittimes.net/2012/06/10/x-cite-by-alghanim-electronics-wins-best-overall-retailer-at-gamestream12-me-awards/|accessdate=22 April 2013|newspaper=Kuwait Times}}</ref> * ‘Best In-Store Experience of the Year 2012’ by Middle East Retail Academy Awards * ‘Best Post Paid Sales 2012’ award from VIVA Telecom<ref>{{cite web|title=X-cite wins 2012 best Viva postpaid sales award|url=http://www.meed.com/sectors/telecoms-and-it/it-and-technology/x-cite-wins-2012-best-viva-postpaid-sales-award/3159734.article#|work=MEED|accessdate=22 April 2013}}</ref>
